Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
To your stations! We're under attack!
Sì, Capitano! We're all right behind you!
@BATTLE
Good job as usual out there, Espero.
Grazie, Capitano.
Now, for our next assignment, we're to meet with an officer and receive some documents outlining our subsequent steps.
An officer? In person? We can't contact someone and have them relay the information via radio?
Apparently, there are certain files with far too much information for us to transcribe. Seeing as we plan to pass by this person on our travels anyway, we've been told to collect the paper ourselves.
Fair enough. I wonder what kind of top secret information these documents hold?

Fields.MenuText: Not another ancient scroll, I hope.

Fields.DialogueText: Right! Going on another elaborate mission to try and uncover the secrets to this invasion... how very boring...

Fields.MenuText: We'll find out soon enough.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm looking forward to it!

Fields.MenuText: Why is your eye sparkling...?

Fields.DialogueText: You must be seeing things, Capitano! I'm certainly not thinking about the possible treasures that might be found during our next mission.
I'll let you know when we're about to dock. Aside from that, you're dismissed.
Capitano! That looks like the officer.
I believe so. Let's make a good impression.
I believe you two are expecting me?
That we are.
Very well. Here are the documents you are to read over in preparation for your next assignment.
Is there a brief hidden somewhere under this stack of novels?
You're looking at it.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you very much for delivering these to us. We really appreciate it, don't we, Espero?

Fields.DialogueText: I've been told to hand these papers to you and nothing more. If that's all, I'll be on my--
Wait, is this also part of the brief?
What the--?! How did you get a hold of that!
It was on top of the pile.
I must have misplaced it. This is not part of your assignment, so forget you ever saw it.
*ALARM*
Do us both a favor and take care of those Morganas. Dismissed!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Is all of this really necessary?

Fields.DialogueText: How are we expected to read through all this?! The war will end before we hit the halfway point!

Fields.MenuText: Any idea what kind of assignment requires this much paperwork?

Fields.DialogueText: You look deep in thought there, Espero. What are you studying so intent--
Niente! Nothing at all!
Wait a minute... Is that...
It is! It's the piece of paper the officer told us to ignore! How did you... Why am I even asking when I already know the answer...?
I had to know why he was so against us seeing it, Capitano. Now I know!
And what is it?
It's a map!

Fields.MenuText: To what? A way to defeat the Morganas again?

Fields.DialogueText: Not this time, Capitano. This time it's more personal.

Fields.MenuText: We've been burned before, Espero.

Fields.DialogueText: This time will be different, Capitano. Trust me, I can feel it!

Fields.MenuText: When did you even manage to pickpocket it?

Fields.DialogueText: A magician never reveals her secrets, Capitano.
So where will this map lead us?
To buried treasure!
Come again?
Take a look. There are several Xs dotted about the map with a path connecting them. Surely if we follow the instructions, we'll find something worthwhile at the end.
*ALARM*
Let's see if we can find a way to take out these Morganas first.
@BATTLE
Tell me more about this map, Espero.
Certo. I did some digging on the officer we met with. Apparently, during his last mission, he came across a rogue vessel fleeing from the Morganas.
Go on.
I checked with the higher-ups and everything on that ship was present and accounted for. No one pocketed any of the cargo.
As it should be.
At least, nothing anyone would think to check for.

Fields.MenuText: So this map is supposed to lead us to our fortune?
What good is a lifetime of riches if the Morganas cut that life short?

Fields.DialogueText: This war will end someday, Capitano, with us as the victors. When that day comes, we can retire like royalty!
You'll have to join me if you want to find out!

Fields.MenuText: I don't know if I want to go through all this again. What if it's a trap?

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't half the fun finding out?
By the looks of it, we'll be following the same path as this map for a while anyway. We'll hit the Xs as we go along and see if they amount to anything.
*ALARM*
We can't search for buried treasure if we're all dead. Let's handle these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Capitano! Can we stop here for a moment?
What's the problem?
The first X should be right around here.
But there's nothing but sea for miles.
Nothing on the surface, that is.
Are you suggesting...?
Maybe our first clue lies beneath the water!
You want someone to dive down there and have a look?
Exactly.

Fields.MenuText: Fine, I'll send someone down there. But they'll only look for two minutes.

Fields.DialogueText: We have a tight schedule to keep, after all. I can respect that.

Fields.MenuText: While they're down there, I suppose you'd like for this diver to scavenge any drowned loot he can find as well.

Fields.DialogueText: You know me too well, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Can't you go yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: I would, but I just finished washing my hair.
It can't be helped. I'll have someone see what they can dig up.
*ALARM*
Molto bene! And you can leave the Morganas to me!
@BATTLE
Capitano!
There you are, Espero. Is your deep sea dive nearly over?
We just finished up.
And did it prove fruitful?
You tell me. Ecco.
What is that? An empty bottle?
In which we found this slip of paper. There are coordinates here and a picture of a small puzzle box. I think it's the next piece we need for the hunt!
Let me see those. If I'm not mistaken, these coordinates will lead us to a port town up ahead. We were supposed to pass by it.
I don't suppose you're up for a quick detour?

Fields.MenuText: I must admit, I'm slightly intrigued.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you'd come around eventually, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: I'm still a little worried.

Fields.DialogueText: Non preoccuparti. If something happens, I'll give my life before I let anyone on this ship come to harm.

Fields.MenuText: Surely this is all too convenient.

Fields.DialogueText: The map was designed for *someone* to be able to find the treasure, right? Is it so strange that by following the clues, we're making progress?
*ALARM*
Leave the Morganas to me, Capitano. You just focus on getting us to land as quickly as possible.
@BATTLE
It's nice to touch down on land again, isn't it, Capitano?
The fresh air is certainly nice, but remember we're here for a reason.
Certo. How do you suggest we start?
The most logical thing to do would be to start asking around.
Buona idea. We can see if anyone has any idea what this puzzle box might be or where it is kept.
I'll take the north path and you see if anyone to the south has any ideas.
Sì!

Fields.MenuText: And don't steal anything while I'm gone.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano! I wouldn't dream of such a thing!
Wouldn't you?
... D'accordo. I'd *only* dream of such a thing.

Fields.MenuText: Let's see if your theory holds true...

Fields.DialogueText: I'll expect some kind of a reward if I'm right!

Fields.MenuText: If this lead proves valuable, I'll be sure to show my thanks.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll get started on my wish list just as soon as we get back on the ship!
*ALARM*
Did you hear that, Capitano? That sounded like our siren! I'll head back and catch up with you later.
@BATTLE
Capitano! Over here!
You've found something.
Take a look at that vendor's stall.
There it is! The puzzle box!
Now, take a look at the price.
What kind of rare gem does this merchant think that box is?
He described it as priceless pirate treasure. It was found *near* a wrecked pirate ship, at any rate.
Uh-huh. Under a bridge he's also selling, I'd wager.
I have an idea, but you're going to have to trust me.

Fields.MenuText: I always do.

Fields.DialogueText: Grazie, Tesoro.

Fields.MenuText: I can tell when your mind is already made up.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't let you down.

Fields.MenuText: Am I going to like this plan?

Fields.DialogueText: That depends on how jealous of a capitano you are.
It looks like we don't have any other choice. Do what you need to do. I'll head back to the ship and make sure we aren't being overrun by Morganas. Wait for me to get back.
Sì, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Buongiorno.
Look, I already told you I'm not budging on the price.
Of course, I wouldn't dream of haggling any further. I really admire a man with strong conviction.
Yeah...?
And a business owner as well. Your wife must be over the moon to have landed such a catch.
N-no wife, unfortunately.
You're kidding! Well, I'm sure the right woman will show up eventually. Just so long as you don't let her...
Slip through your fingers...
*Gulp*
Right then, I'll be off now. I can't afford that puzzle box. Have a nice--
Wait!
*ALARM*
Capitano, be a dear and see to the Morganas, would you? I have some things to discuss with this fine gentleman.
@BATTLE
I see you acquired the puzzle box.
Is that a hint of jealousy I detect in your words, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I suppose you've pulled similar stunts with me?

Fields.DialogueText: Heavens, no! I would never fake my affection for you, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what you're talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: You have nothing to worry about, Capitano. Mine and the merchant's romance will have to wait until after the war is done. Until that day, I won't leave your side.

Fields.MenuText: Would you like it if I did the same thing?

Fields.DialogueText: You're free to try it if you want to test me. I won't be responsible for what happens to you, though...
I'll admit to being a little jealous.
Don't worry, mio Tesoro. The merchant received the starter. You will be the one sampling the main course.
*gulp*
Shall we head back to the ship?
Y-yes! We got what we came for. Let's head back at once.
That's why, in your case, a flash of the old doe eyes is enough to coax you into submission.
How goes the puzzle box, Espero?
I've nearly cracked it.

Fields.MenuText: Couldn't we just break it open?

Fields.DialogueText: What if something fragile is inside? We can't risk it.

Fields.MenuText: I'm still worried this could be a trap or prank or something.

Fields.DialogueText: Let's see what's inside first.

Fields.MenuText: Can I help?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd love a coffee. Lots of cream, lots of sugar.
Almost... L'ho fatto!
What is...?
It's a key! This must be used to unlock the treasure chest at the end of the map!
The one we're certain exists.
I knew I was right to trust my gut. I had a feeling this time would be different. I'll prove everyone wrong. Whoever doubted me will live to regret it.
I hope I'm not in that camp of people.
That depends. Are you behind me now?
One hundred percent.
Then you have nothing to worry about!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's dispatch them quickly, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Everything okay, Espero?
Ah, Capitano. I'm fine.
Are you sure? You look a little stressed.
What gave me away?
Well, the ten or so cigarette butts around you were a hint.
I've been studying the map a little more. At some point, the Xs just stop.
Stop?
Look here. There's a trail connecting the Xs.
Right.
We've been following along this trail from the previous X. But now there's no next point.
I see.
Maybe I was wrong after all...

Fields.MenuText: Don't say that.

Fields.DialogueText: If you still believe in me, then maybe I can find the strength to keep going.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure there's something we just can't see.

Fields.DialogueText: Grazie, Capitano. For always believing in me.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not one to say I told you so...

Fields.DialogueText: This is no time for jokes, Capitano.
Hold on. What's that?
What's what? Non vedo niente.
It's faint, but it almost looks like...
What?
Hold your lighter under here. Careful you don't burn the paper.
Like this?
Bingo!
The final X! It must have been written using some kind of distilled ink!
What did I tell you?
Grazie, Capitano!
*ALARM*
Allow me to take out the Morganas to show my thanks.
@BATTLE
Can you imagine a life with wealth beyond your wildest dreams, Capitano?
What's gotten you thinking so longingly? It isn't like you to spend your time daydreaming.
When it comes to coin, I can't help myself.
I already consider myself to be a rich person.
How so?
I have my health, my crew, and...
And?
*Ahem* More on that another time. What would you do?
I can't begin to imagine! A new wardrobe? A lengthy holiday? A shipwide renovation? The possibilities are endless!

Fields.MenuText: Your wardrobe looked pretty packed the last time I was in your quarters.

Fields.DialogueText: Snooping through my belongings, were you, Capitano? I wish you wouldn't do that. If you want some kind of memento, all you have to do is ask.

Fields.MenuText: Where would this holiday take you?

Fields.DialogueText: Around the world, of course! There are still so many places I have yet to visit... and a great many locals who would open their pockets to help a lost tourist!

Fields.MenuText: An upgrade wouldn't hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't have to wait for a treasure chest to do that, Capitano! I'll send in the order now.
I hope you don't plan on forgetting me once your payday comes in.
I could never. You have to be there to keep me grounded. Who knows what I'd do otherwise!
*ALARM*
For now at least, I give you permission to fly! Let's take out the Morganas!
Sì!
@BATTLE
With what money?
That merchant isn't the only one carrying a torch for me. Or a rifle, as the case may be.
I can almost smell that treasure!
I didn't think of you as a common thief.
I think so too, but a good heist is too hard to resist.
You know what I mean. I figured you more for the memento type.
Ovviamente no. There's nothing common about me.

Fields.MenuText: You're sounding less like a sailor and more like a spy.

Fields.DialogueText: Who's to say my time aboard this ship hasn't all been an elaborate plan to rinse you for all you're worth?
If that were your plan, you could have accomplished it ages ago.
Even criminals have a heart, Capitano. There's time yet to see the error of my ways and stay with you. Stranger things have happened.
Enlighten me. What's the most valuable thing you've ever stolen?

Fields.MenuText: Would you ever consider taking on a partner in crime?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure if you have the stomach for such a life, Capitano. I think it would be better if I were the breadwinner and you ensure I have a meal to come home to.

Fields.MenuText: I'm starting to think it's the sense of danger you enjoy more than the keepsakes.

Fields.DialogueText: You know me too well, Capitano. I'm always one for a brush with danger.
I couldn't possibly tell you. It's far too important to speak about so casually.
Come on! I'm curious now.
I'm afraid--
Come on. Rubies? Diamonds?
Nothing like that.
Then what?
Your heart...
*ALARM*
Morganas...?
Morganas.
@BATTLE
We're closing in on the final location, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: Stay alert. We don't know what could happen.

Fields.DialogueText: Sì. I've got my eyes peeled for any suspicious movements.

Fields.MenuText: Hopefully this will all have been worth it.

Fields.DialogueText: It's still an adventure with or without treasure. Just... a less shiny one.

Fields.MenuText: Do you still want to continue?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! Don't get cold feet now, Capitano!
Look ahead!
Morganas! And not just a ragtag fleet...
It's as if they're guarding the final X.
This is probably how those pirates met their fate! They were running from this armada!
That was their first mistake. Push on!
@BATTLE
Yes... Yes... Understood.
Who was that on the radio, Capitano?
My direct superiors.
What did they say?
Apparently, they're a little angry we haven't reached the port yet.
Port?
For our original mission. We were to meet at the port and receive even more documents, but we're late.
Infatti... We've gone way off course, haven't we?

Fields.MenuText: After this, we'll have to speed over to the next port.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll shoulder all the blame, Capitano. After all, this was my idea.

Fields.MenuText: I told them we had to keep stopping to resupply.

Fields.DialogueText: They might overstock us and send us to a maelstrom if they believe our story. Be very careful what you wish for.

Fields.MenuText: Hopefully we don't get in too much trouble.

Fields.DialogueText: If the treasure is real, I'm sure we can buy our way out of trouble!
*ALARM*
Morganas! They must be some stragglers from before!
@BATTLE
Capitano, ecco. Can you see that?
That ominous-looking cave in the distance? Yes, I can see it...
The treasure is either in that cave or on the other side.

Fields.MenuText: The things I do for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate it all, Capitano! So much so that I'm willing to split the treasure. 70/30.
That's generous of you.

Fields.MenuText: Well, which is it?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know exactly. The final X covers quite a bit I would have liked to see.

Fields.MenuText: Only one thing left to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Full speed ahead!
I feel like you're misinterpreting the split, Capitano.
Espero?
Why the hesitation?
It's just...

Fields.MenuText: You aren't scared of the cave, are you?
Don't worry, I'll protect you.
We're so close!

Fields.DialogueText: Ovviamente no!
This has nothing to do with that!
Lo so!
Then what is it?
Forget it! Just keep going...
*ALARM*
We'll seek cover in that cave. Satisfied?
@BATLE
That cave was far spookier than I thought it would be.
I don't think I've ever seen so many bats before.
Which is why I find it kind of strange...
That this side of the tunnel has little to no sound whatsoever?
Right! I'm not going crazy. I can't hear a single seagull, breeze, or chirp.

Fields.MenuText: We really are in uncharted territory.

Fields.DialogueText: Even the animals must have been too afraid to leave the cave. What must be on this side?

Fields.MenuText: We should keep quiet too.

Fields.DialogueText: Good idea. If there is something hostile on this side, we'll soon draw attention to ourselves with no other noise in the area.

Fields.MenuText: Scared?

Fields.DialogueText: Who are you talking to?!
In the distance... Is that...?
It looks like its some Morganas. I guess murderous hellspawn have no trouble traveling through that cave.
Don't sound the alarm. We need to sneak up on them. We'll take them out before they can make a noise.
Sì.
@BATTLE
It looks like those Morganas were guarding this small rock formation.

Fields.MenuText: I wonder what for?

Fields.DialogueText: We must be close to the treasure.

Fields.MenuText: Shall we take a look?

Fields.DialogueText: Let's make sure our surroundings are clear first.

Fields.MenuText: Could the treasure be there?

Fields.DialogueText: I surely hope so.
Let's wait a moment before we let down our guard. Stay sharp.
How romantic. A stakeout date.

Fields.MenuText: Is that sarcasm?
I'll try harder next time...
Just call me Romeo.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all! This kind of thing is right up my alley.
I wasn't being sarcastic, but now I'm intrigued! I very much look forward to whatever you have planned.
Slow down, Casanova. Let's save the pet names until after we've been on at least one dinner date!
More Morganas on approach.
Leave them to me, Capitano. I won't make a sound.
@BATTLE
The Morganas just keep coming!

Fields.MenuText: Could whatever is on this rock formation be calling them?!

Fields.DialogueText: Or it could just be an unfortunate coincidence. We can discuss science later.

Fields.MenuText: This better be worth it.

Fields.DialogueText: If it isn't, I'll be forever in your debt.

Fields.MenuText: Can you keep fighting?

Fields.DialogueText: It will take more fleets than this to push me to my limit!
This looks to be the last of them. After this, we'll pull up to the rock formation and see if there's anything hidden between its walls.
Sì, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Capitano, look! A chest!
Well, I'll be damned.
It looks pretty battered and waterlogged, but apart from that, it seems relatively intact.
Well, what are you waiting for! Let's open the damn thing!

Fields.MenuText: Espero?
Don't keep me in suspense!
Shall I open it for you?

Fields.DialogueText: N-nothing! It's just...
Right...
No, I can do it...
What's wrong?
What if I'm wrong? What if I've sent us on this wild goose chase for nothing but my own selfish sense of pride?
Ah.
I can't believe you fell for that!
*ALARM*
I expressly said DON'T sound the--
It's a Morgana fleet!
Quickly, get the chest on board! We'll open it after getting to safety!
@BATTLE
Pff!
... Listen, my time in command has taught me the value of doubt. The ability to question your own biases is--
Yeah, yeah. Is it safe?
No, I'm checking it for traps.
Nothing's "safe," Capitano. But I'm ready to open it if you--
The Morganas are gaining on us! Espero?! Are you awake?!
Capitano... Look...
What are you...? Wow...
I couldn't resist. I just had to open it.
Gold!
Rubies!
Diamonds!
Our grandchildren will live like kings with this amount of wealth!

Fields.MenuText: You were right!

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't want to say anything, but I'll gladly let you say it for me!

Fields.MenuText: What was my cut again?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe it was 80/20 in my favor, no?

Fields.MenuText: Shut that lid before it spills overboard!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! I just can't tear my eyes away.
Espero... I just want to say. If your hesitation from before was about...
I just want to say, I never doubted you for a--
Please, Capitano! Let's save the reassuring pep talk for after we convert these jewels into cold hard cash!
Right! Let's try to outrun the Morganas as best we can and get that loot to safety.
Sì, Capitano! Laying down suprressing fire!
@BATTLE
Capitano, I've just had a report that there's a reef up ahead!
Good I was informed! We'll have to turn! Ready the cannons!
We can't, Capitano! We're out of all forms of ammunition! If we turn, we'll be sitting ducks!

Fields.MenuText: So you expect us to plow through?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not!
What should we do?!

Fields.MenuText: How?!

Fields.DialogueText: We've been fending off so many Morganas since we exited that cave! We've exhausted our entire reserves!

Fields.MenuText: What are the chances we survive?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't really want to find out!
There is one thing we could load into the cannons. Something hard, sharp, and sure to leave a dent.
You don't mean...
If we load all the treasure, we should be able to cover our flank and make a safe escape.
But then you'll have no proof you were right.
It's okay, Capitano. As long as you believe me, that's all that matters.
It pains me to say it, but... Load the treasure! We're not dying here today!
@BATTLE
Keep firing!
It's working! The gems are shredding the enemies' hulls!
Don't let up yet!

Fields.MenuText: How much more do we need to load?

Fields.DialogueText: Every last piece of it, Capitano! Our lives are worth more than anything. We can't afford to be greedy and play things safe.

Fields.MenuText: With each shot fired, my future bank balance decreases...

Fields.DialogueText: At least you will still have a future!

Fields.MenuText: My real treasure won't be going anywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: I think so too!
One last push!
@BATTLE
We made it.
And the treasure?
Gone, per your orders.
Good. Good...

Fields.MenuText: Will you be okay?

Fields.DialogueText: The world is full of riches, Capitano. But you can't put a price on life.

Fields.MenuText: You'll have a hard time getting anyone to believe this story.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't plan on telling it. As long as you know I was right, I can put up with a torrent of disbelief.

Fields.MenuText: We should get back soon. We'll likely be in big trouble for diverging from our set course for such a long time.

Fields.DialogueText: It's a shame we have nothing left to bribe them with. Unless you'd like me to work my "magic" again.
I would have thought you might have pocketed a diamond or two, but it looks like you truly loaded every last gem into the cannon.
I thought about it. But I wouldn't have been able to live with myself if that one stray diamond meant the difference between life and death.
Your resilience is admirable.
Not me, Capitano. We all have something we'd be willing to die for. It is you I couldn't bear to see come to harm.
Espero...
I may have lost a lot of money today, but I held on to the true treasure. Mio Tesoro, I won't allow you to make your way into the afterlife before me.
*ALARM*
Leave the Morganas to me. There are just a couple of stragglers. You stay here where I can keep an eye on you.
@BATTLE
Yes. Of course.
He's really chewing you out, huh?
Sh!
I assure you, nothing like this will happen again... No, I accept full responsibility.
But--!
SH! Yes, it was my idea to take a short detour. I'll explain my reasoning via letter and await the consequences... Thank you.
Don't worry. With your track record, they'll go easy on you.
I certainly hope so.
Grazie, mio Tesoro. If I get in any more trouble, I'm not long for this war. I'll be sat in a dock collecting rust as punishment.
And we can't have that, can we? I need you by my side.
Capitano...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's handle them quickly!
@BATTLE
Capitano...
Yes?
About what you were saying earlier...

Fields.MenuText: Don't look so serious, Espero; it doesn't suit you.

Fields.DialogueText: I can be serious at times! At least, when I'm with you...

Fields.MenuText: Is something the matter?

Fields.DialogueText: Nope! Nothing at all. Grazie again, Capitano. For believing in me.

Fields.MenuText: What was that again?

Fields.DialogueText: You've already forgotten?!
What I was going to say isn't important. What is important is that you never doubt that gut of yours again.
I won't!
There's a mess of treasure out there and I don't plan on concluding this war until I can retire in luxury afterwards.
I'll get you there, mio Tesoro. Just stay by my side and I'll do the rest!
